CatDescriptText: Charles James, Garfield and Ida Mosley, housewife, Homewood, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 5, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think voters will choose the Republican or the Democratic candidate for the presidency?"  Mr. James' answer reads: "I think Democratic because it's time for a change.  However, the times have been pretty good under the Republicans."  Mrs. Mosley's answer reads: "I hope that it's a Democratic President, because I like the Democrats."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Charles James wearing eyeglasses and fedora, standing on Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Ida Mosley wearing patterned head scarf and dark overcoat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
